page.title: 16CHILDRENS GAMES
page.content: The type of games played by children in this area fall into four distinct groups. There are ball games for boys using either hands (KERBY,KINGY, TIN- CAN-TOMMY) or feet (SPOT,NETTY,CUPPIE, and HEADERS AND VOLLEYS). Then there are ball games for girls using one or two balls against a wall (DONKEY, SEVENS and QUEENIE-O).Next there are various tag games such as RALLYCOE, SCARECROW and TIGGY OF THE GROUND all basically chase and catch games or BUZZ-OFF,TWENTY-TWENTY and FOX AND HOUNDS all games of hide and seek. There are also various forms of skipping games such as DOUBLE DUTCH in which two ropes are used in contra- rotation and others using singing rhymes including LORD NELSON,POLLY IN THE KITCHEN,TEDDY ON THE TELEPHONE and BLUEBELLS. Other traditional games played include FRENCH CRICKET,BULLDOG
